text: Kenneth Walter Oxenford Coulson (born 1910) is a former English international lawn bowler. ==Bowls career== Coulson became the first British singles champion after winning the British Isles Bowls Championships in 1959, when bowling for England and the Croydon Bowls Club. He qualified for the event by virtue of winning the English singles crown the previous year. He was a motor car salesman by trade and was first capped by England in 1955. ==References== Category:1910 births Category:Possibly living people Category:English male bowls players
title: Kenneth Coulson
